author: Staff Reporter
text:
A legal aid clinic to provide free legal assistance to students was inaugurated at the Bharathidasan Government College for Women here on Tuesday. The clinic will function on the first and 15th of every month from 2 p.m. to 4 p.m. and will be managed by the Union Territory of Puducherry Legal Services Authority.

Inaugurating the legal aid clinic, Labour court Judge, N. Sivakumar, said the clinic will cater to over 3000 students of the institution. The clinic will have a senior faculty member of the institution as chairman, an advocate of the UTPLSA and a student nominee of the institution.

According to a release, the UTPLSA has also identified Jipmer and Pondicherry University for setting up of Legal Services Clinics exclusively for students hailing from north-eastern states. The number of students hailing from the North East is 66 and 307 respectively as furnished by both the institutions.
title: Legal aid clinic for students
